text:
“I know we are going in together, but I want to say good-bye here. So give me your hand!” 

“What’s the matter with you, Rodya?” 

“Nothing… come along. You shall be witness.” 

They climbed the stairs. 

Razumihin thought, “Ah, I’ve upset him with my chatter!” 

At the door, they heard voices inside. 

“What is it?” cried Razumihin. 

Raskolnikov opened the door wide. 

His mother and sister sat on the sofa, waiting. 

Why hadn’t he expected them? 

They had spent an hour and a half asking Nastasya questions. 

Alarm filled their faces when they heard of his running away. 

“Good Heavens, what had become of him?” 

They rushed to him with cries of joy. 

But he stood still, struck by a thunderbolt. 

He could not lift his arms to embrace them.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov is taken aback by the unexpected arrival of his mother and sister, who are filled with concern for his well-being.
